intro: Comesperma confertum, commonly known as the broad-leaved comesperma, is a species of flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and dense foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, which bloom in spring. Its leaves are broad and leathery, adapted to the dry conditions of its natural habitat. Comesperma confertum is often found in heathlands and sclerophyllous forests, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
